citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: United States Federal and Indian Land Areas, 2008

serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
United States Federal and Indian Land Areas is a polygon theme representing the federal- and Indian-owned land areas (for example, Bureau of Indian Affairs, Department of Defense, and Tennessee Valley Authority) of the United States.
This dataset is from the 2008 ESRI Data & Maps Collection.
descript.purpose: United States Federal and Indian Land Areas provides the federal- and Indian-owned land areas for geographic display and analysis at regional and national levels.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:1,000,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States: Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials. The minimum map resolution is 640 acres or one square mile. Generally, features under this size are not shown. There may be private inholdings within the boundaries of Federal lands in this map layer.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was originally extracted from the individual 1:2,000,000-scale State boundary Digital Line Graph (DLG) files produced by the U.S. Geological Survey which have a positional accuracy of 1,720 meters. It was updated several times using various sources whose horizontal positional accuracies are unknown.

citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: Federal Lands of the United States, 2008

procstep.procdesc: The National Atlas file was originally compiled from 1:2,000,000-scale Digital Line Graph files produced in the early 1980's. Between 1997 and 2003, the file was updated multiple times using a variety of Federal and State sources, both to adjust boundaries and to add or delete areas as appropriate. The final version of this file was produced in October 2003. Using Wildlife refuge area updates from the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Wilderness area updates from the USDA Forest Service, Rocky Mountain Research Station, Aldo Leopold Wilderness Research Institute, and Wilderness area data from the National Wilderness Preservation System, the following updates were made: boundary updates to national wildlife refuges and wilderness areas; addition of several national wildlife refuges, waterfowl production areas, and wilderness areas; adjustment of wilderness study areas which had been converted to wilderness areas; and name corrections for several areas. Adjacent Federal lands having identical attributes were merged.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the federal- and Indian-owned lands of 640 acres or more within United States.
enttyp.enttypds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The primary or only type of Federal or Indian land and the owning agency. Where a polygon represents multiple Federal or Indian land types, this attribute describes the smaller or 'contained' land.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attr.attrdef: The secondary type of Federal or Indian land and the owning agency. Where a polygon represents multiple Federal or Indian land types, this attribute, in general, describes a land that surrounds or 'contains' the land referenced in FEATURE1. FEATURE2 may also be coded as 'Open Water' if a part of the Federal or Indian property referenced in FEATURE1 includes water.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attr.attrdef: The tertiary type of Federal or Indian land and the owning agency. Where a polygon represents multiple Federal or Indian land types, this attribute, in general, describes a land that surrounds or 'contains' the land referenced in FEATURE2. FEATURE3 may also be coded as 'Open Water' if a part of the Federal or Indian property referenced in FEATURE2 includes water.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey
National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey
